nextEvent.title: Pitch Playoffs #002
nextEvent.hook: Demo your startup, get crowd votes, pitch to real VCs.

events.title: Silicon Valley Investing Summit
events.description: An exclusive gathering that brought together select startups and accredited investors for curated dealflow and high-level networking at the heart of Silicon Valley.

events.title: Pitch Playoffs #001
events.description: An evening where physical AI startups showcase their products while attendees invest three voting tokens in their favorites, with the top three earning a live Shark Tank‚Äìstyle pitch in front of an investor panel and a room full of builders.

events.title: Ice Tank Challenge
events.description: The ultimate test of resilience and conviction. Founders pitched to VCs while immersed in an ice tank - proving that the best pitches come from those who can stay cool under pressure, literally. This unique challenge separated the committed from the casual, creating unforgettable moments and real connections.

events.title: AI X ROBOTICS
events.description: An electrifying evening showcasing the intersection of artificial intelligence and robotics. Founders from cutting-edge AI and robotics startups pitched their innovations to a panel of top VCs, demonstrating the future of technology.

successStories.title: Petpin AI
successStories.tagline: Turning an AI Pet Startup Into a Crowd Favorite
successStories.description: Petpin AI is an AI-powered wearable that lets pet owners see the world from their pet's point of view ‚Äî combining computer vision, behavioral insights, and emotional storytelling into one delightful product.
successStories.challenge: As an early-stage startup building cutting-edge consumer AI hardware, Petpin AI needed to:
challengePoints: Introduce a new category (AI wearables for pets)
Explain complex technology simply and emotionally
Capture attention in a high-energy, competitive event environment
Generate excitement, conversation, and early adopters
successStories.ourRole: At SF Playground, we curated an environment that helped Petpin AI:
rolePoints: üé§ Present their story clearly to a live audience
üß† Demonstrate AI value through hands-on interaction
ü§ù Connect with builders, investors, and early users
üì£ Spark organic word-of-mouth across the event floor
successStories.experience:
Petpin AI's showcase focused on emotion-first storytelling:

Live demos showing pets' POV footage

App walkthroughs highlighting mood detection and auto-generated clips

One-on-one conversations explaining how AI enhances everyday pet care

The result was an experience that felt personal, fun, and futuristic ‚Äî not overly technical.
successStories.impact: Petpin AI's presence at the event delivered real results:
impactPoints: üöÄ High attendee engagement throughout the event
üêæ Strong emotional response from pet owners and tech enthusiasts
üìà Increased brand awareness and post-event traffic
üí¨ Consistent buzz across conversations, demos, and social sharing
successStories.founderQuote: "This event helped us explain Petpin AI in a way people immediately felt. Watching attendees light up when they saw their pets' POV was incredible."
successStories.attendeeQuote: "This was one of the most memorable demos at the event. It was fun, emotional, and genuinely innovative."
successStories.founderQuote2: "Petpin AI felt like the kind of product you remember after the event ends."
successStories.whyMatters:
Petpin AI is a great example of how the right event environment can accelerate a startup's story ‚Äî turning a product demo into a moment people remember.

At SF Playground, we don't just host events ‚Äî we help ideas land.

successStories.title: Spacer Robotics
successStories.tagline: From Construction Sites to the Moon ‚Äî Building the Future of Physical AI
successStories.description: Spacer Robotics develops next-generation AI robots for construction, with a roadmap that extends from terrestrial job sites to lunar infrastructure. Founded by Lesya Hendrix, former Tesla and Nuro engineer, the company is deploying GRID ‚Äî an autonomous rebar-tying robot ‚Äî while building toward semi-humanoid robots and eventually space-ready lunar construction systems.
successStories.challenge: As a hardware startup building physical AI for construction and space, Spacer Robotics needed to:
challengePoints: Communicate a bold vision spanning Earth and Moon
Demonstrate real-world applicability of GRID on job sites
Stand out among AI and robotics startups at a competitive event
Connect with investors who understand deep tech and infrastructure
successStories.ourRole: At SF Playground, we created a platform that helped Spacer Robotics:
rolePoints: üé§ Pitch their three-generation roadmap to a live VC panel
ü§ñ Showcase GRID's capabilities to builders and investors
ü§ù Build relationships with construction and space-industry contacts
üì£ Generate momentum for their 2026 deployment and 2033 lunar vision
successStories.experience:
Spacer Robotics' showcase blended technical depth with ambitious storytelling:

Live demos and visuals of GRID's autonomous rebar tying

Clear explanation of Gen 1 (task-focused), Gen 2 (semi-humanoid), and Gen 3 (lunar) roadmap

One-on-one conversations with investors interested in physical AI and infrastructure

The result was an experience that felt both grounded in real construction and aspirational about the future of work ‚Äî on Earth and beyond.
successStories.impact: Spacer Robotics' presence at the event delivered tangible outcomes:
impactPoints: üöÄ Strong investor interest in their construction-to-space thesis
üèóÔ∏è Connections with construction and infrastructure partners
üìà Increased visibility for GRID and their 2026 deployment timeline
üí¨ Recognition as a standout in the physical AI and robotics space
successStories.founderQuote: "SF Playground gave us a stage to share our vision ‚Äî from rebar tying today to building on the Moon by 2033. The audience got it."
successStories.attendeeQuote: "One of the most ambitious pitches of the night. You could feel the room leaning in when they talked about lunar construction."
successStories.founderQuote2: "Spacer Robotics came to connect with people who think big. We found them here."
successStories.whyMatters:
Spacer Robotics shows how the right event can amplify a startup with a long-horizon vision ‚Äî turning a technical pitch into a story that resonates with builders and dreamers alike.

At SF Playground, we don't just host events ‚Äî we help ideas land.
